content.description:
Start in a diagonal seam with good feet and make one move to the rounded, gritty top before manteling over. This problem is a bit height dependent perhaps.

Rated V3 in previous guides but it seems much easier than that.
content.location:
Left side of the east face, just left of

Melonizer

right of a large dead tree.

content.description:
Start at an obvious black intrusion and balance your way up the featured face above past a series of good edges.

Rated V2 in previous guides but it seems a little easier than that.
content.location:
Center of the east face between

Mini-Melon

and

Classic Melon

.

content.description:
Start off a block around and right from

Enter the Melon

and climb the featured face above with a bad landing into boulders if you fall off.

This problem isn't listed in the Joshua Tree Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.
content.location: Left side of the west face.

content.description:
A quick pull on small but incut edges gets you to a sculpted jug after which it's fun climbing up bumps and edges to the top.

Starting off the boulder to the right and traversing in above the crux to finish the same is a fun variation that goes at V-easy.
content.location:
Center of the narrow north face and around and right from

Classic Melon

.

content.description:
Powerful opposition moves at the start gain a small hole to a classic finish up a balancy thin face passing a small grey knob. Quality.

Rated V2 in previous bouldering guides but it seems a bit harder than that.
content.location:
Right side of the east face between

Melonizer

and

Enter the Melon

.
